GMSMap Class Reference

Class to generate a mcm file from different raw mapdata. More...

#include <GMSMap.h>

Collaboration diagram for GMSMap:

List of all members.

Area feature draw display class.

Methods for detect water-in-park etc area feature draw display classes, which are needed due to the fact that the MC2 drawing methods cannot handle holes.
  • typedef map< uint32, MC2BoundingBox > mapItemIdToBB_t
  • typedef multimap< ItemTypes::itemType,
    OldItem * > mapTypeToItemId_t
    Def.
  • void areaFeatureDrawDisplayClassesInit (mapItemIdToBB_t &mapItemIdToBB, mapTypeToItemId_t &mapTypeToItem)
    Init which types of items in items we want to consider for new area feature display classes.
  • void itemInItemToDisplayClass (ItemTypes::areaFeatureDrawDisplayClass_t displayClass, uint32 interiorItemMaxLength, uint32 exteriorItemMinLength, bool compareIntWithExt, float quotaRequired, mapTypeToItemId_t *interiorItemsToUse, mapTypeToItemId_t *exteriorItemsToUse, mapItemIdToBB_t mapItemIdToBB, mapTypeToItemId_t mapTypeToItemId, mapTypeToItemId_t *foundInteriorItems)
    Method to compute which items belong to one specific area feature draw display class.

Create methods.
Virtual methods to create new items.

Virtual methods to create new items. This methods are identical to the ones i OldMap, except that these methods creates GMSItem's etc. These excist to make it possible to create a GMSMap (with GMSItem's and GMSGfxData) from a .mcm-file.

  • virtual OldItem * createNewItem (DataBuffer *dataBuffer)
    Create a new item.
  • virtual OldConnection * createNewConnection (DataBuffer *dataBuffer)
    Virtual method that creates a new OldConnection out of a databuffer.
  • GMSGfxData * createNewGfxData (DataBuffer *dataBuffer)
    Create a new gfx data.

    Splits streets so that each street will only consist of streetsegments that are close to each other.

Detailed Description

Class to generate a mcm file from different raw mapdata.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

virtual GMSMap::~GMSMap (   )  [virtual]
 

Delete this Map.

GMSMap::GMSMap (  uint32  mapID,
const char *  path
)  [private]
 

Constructor that creates a GMS map from a mcm-file.

Since this method use virtual methods to create most of the objects the map is almost a "true" GMSMap with GMSItems, GSMGfxData, GMSNodes and GMSConnections. But { be aware that not { all} the objects in the database are GMS-objects -- some are created in the OldMap-class without using virtual method!}

Parameters:
mapID ID of the map that should be loaded.
path The path to the new map.
mapOK Outparameter that is set to true if the is loaded alright, false otherwise.

Member Function Documentation

OldNode *  otherNode,
uint32  distOtherNode,
map< uint32, uint32 > *  vtByNode = NULL
) 
 

Add a connection between two nodes.

Parameters:
curNode One of the nodes.
otherNode The other node.
distOtherNode Distance between them.
vtByNode Optional parameter. STL map containing allowed vehicle types by node ID. If specified, used to set the correct restrictions.

bool GMSMap::addExternalItemToMap (  OldGenericMap *  externalMap,
OldItem *  externalItem,
set< IDPair_t > &  addedIDs,
bool  parseOnly = false
)  [private]
 

Checks if the item coming from another map (extra item map) fits in the map and if that is the case, then it will be added to this map.

Parameters:
externalMap The external map where the item originally comes from.
externalItem The external item to be added to this map (if it fits).
addedIDs Set containing the ids of the items being added to the map. Both input and output parameter.
parseOnly Optional param, default is false. If set to true the externalItem will not be added, but the method returns true if it fits.
Returns:
True if the item was found to fit in this map and that the item was succesfully added. False otherwise.

bool GMSMap::addExtraItemsFromMap (  OldGenericMap *  otherMap,
set< IDPair_t > &  addedIDs,
bool  addMunicipals = false
) 
 

Add items (street segments, lakes, forests and so on) from another map to this map.

The items to be added are considered to belong to this map if they fit inside the maps gfxData. For street segments and ferries, they belong if they are within 10 km from this map's gfxdata bbox, and there is a node in this map that the ssi/ferry from the other map can connect to.

Parameters:
otherMap The map with the extra items.
addedIDs [In/Out] Set containing all the items that have been added so far to the map.
addMunicipals If set to false, no municipals will be added. Default value is false.

bool GMSMap::addIndexGroupToItem (  OldItem *  item,
pair< MC2String, MC2String >  indexPost,
map< pair< MC2String, MC2String >, uint32 > &  groupIDsByIndex,
bool  onlySearchable = false
)  [protected]
 

Add a group to an item from a index post (nav index or locality index).

If there are no group corresponding to the index post already in the map,it is created.

Parameters:
item The item to add the group to.
indexPost The index post to add as a group. first: index name second: locality distinction
groupIDsByIndex Outparameter Groups corresponding to index already created in the map. This one is updated when a group is created. Key: first: Index name, second: Index locality distinction. Value: Group ID in the map corresponding to the Index post.
onlySearchable When this one is true, the group is added as a group not to use when showing location.
Returns:
Returns true if the successful, otherwise false.

)  [inline]

void GMSMap::addMultiConnection (  uint32  firstMultiNodeID,
OldNode *  lastMultiNode,
const list< uint32 > &  expandedNodeIDs,
uint32  vehicleRestriction,
ItemTypes::turndirection_t  turnDirection
) 
 

Add a multi connection to the expansion table.

Note that the actual connection must be added to the node as usual, using the OldNode::addConnection method.

Parameters:
firstMultiNodeID The first node id of the multi connection.
lastMultiNode The last node id of the multi connection.
expandedNodeIDs List of nodes covered by the multi connection between the first and last node. I.e. the first and last node should not be included in the list.

bool GMSMap::addSSIToZipCodesUsingGfx (   ) 
 

Adds street segments to zip codes using existing zip code gfxdata in case the zip code doesn't contain any street segments.

In case zipcodes are found that already contain streetsegments (i.e. zipcodes have already been added from attribute data) then all zipcodes without streetsegments are removed.

Returns:
If the method added any streetsegments to the zipcodes based on geometry.

uint32 GMSMap::addToBoundary (  uint32  nodeID  ) 
 

Does everything needed in order to add a node to the boundary.

This includes adding a virtual 0-length segment and adding that virtual segment to the boundrysegments vector.

Parameters:
nodeID The node id to add to the boundary.
Returns:
The id of the added virtual segment if sucessful, otherwise MAX_UINT32.

uint32 GMSMap::addToBoundaryNoConn (  uint32  nodeID  ) 
 

Does everything needed in order to add a node to the boundary, except for creating the connection to the node.

This includes adding a virtual 0-length segment and adding that virtual segment to the boundrysegments vector.

Parameters:
nodeID The node id to add to the boundary.
Returns:
The id of the node not close to boundry of the added virtual segment if sucessful, otherwise MAX_UINT32.

bool GMSMap::addVirtualToMatchExtraItem (  OldGenericMap *  otherMap,
OldItem *  otherItem
)  [private]
 

When adding items from extra item maps and one extra item has been added to another map, this method is called to make sure that there is a virtual item in this map were to make external connections to the virtual item that was added from extra item.

Parameters:
otherMap The external map where the item originally comes from.
otherItem The external item that was added to another map.

bool GMSMap::addZipFromName (  OldItem *  item,
MC2String  zipCodeName
) 
 

Adds a zip code as group to an item.

If the zip code exists in the map, this item is added, otherwise a new zip code is created.

NB! Be careful not to add zip codes any other way after calling this method and use it again. The new zip wont be found by the method.

Parameters:
item The new zip will be group to this item. Set to NULL if no group should be set (only adding zip item).
zipCodeName Name used for finding any already existing zip code or set to the new zip code item.

bool GMSMap::addZipsFromZipPOIFile (  ZipSideFile  zipSideFile,
MC2String  sectionedZipsPath
) 
 

Adds zip codes from zip POI file.

1. Loads the zip POI file in the sectionedZipsPath dir. For format of the zip POI file, see fucntion in cpp-file. 2. Removes all existing zip codes from the map 3. Add zip code for each zip POI to the map 4. Set centre coordinates for each created zip code from the coord the zip poi file. 5. Set the zip codes as group for close street segments with the setZipForSSIs method.

Parameters:
zipSideFile An object which will have the zip poi data loaded into it.
sectionedZipsPath Directory where to find the zip POI files.

void GMSMap::areaFeatureDrawDisplayClassesInit (  mapItemIdToBB_t &  mapItemIdToBB,
mapTypeToItemId_t &  mapTypeToItem
)  [private]
 

Init which types of items in items we want to consider for new area feature display classes.

void GMSMap::buildHashTable (   ) 
 

Add all items to the hashTable.

Overrides protected declaration in OldGenericMap.

Reimplemented from OldGenericMap.

uint32 GMSMap::calcRegionStats (  OldItem *  item,
map< uint32, uint32 > &  regionByNbrOccasions,
ItemTypes::itemType  type
)  [private]
 

Help method to updateMetropolitanBuaMunLoc.

Assumes that streetsegments have correct regions. Will go through all ssi:s that have the item as region, and will count the number of regions of the specified itemtype that the ssi:s also have. The outparameter regionByNbrOccasions is a map containing: key: number of occurances of region in the item value: item id of region. Since it's a map, the keys are sorted in increasing order (i.e. the most common region is last in the map). Note that ssi:s that doesn't contain any region of the specified type, will also be counted. They receive region id MAX_UINT32.

Parameters:
item The item to check regions for.
regionByNbrOccasions [Out] Map containing the result.
type Region item type to check.
Returns:
The total number of ssi:s inside the item. (Also equal to the sum of regionByNbrOccasions keys.)

uint32 GMSMap::changeGroupOfItems (  uint32  origGroupItemID,
uint32  newGroupItemID
) 
 

Looks at all items in the map.

All items having origGroupItemID as group gets newGroupItemID as group instead.

Parameters:
origGroupItemID The item ID of the group to change.
newGroupItemID The item ID of the group to change to.
Returns:
Number of groups changed.

uint32 GMSMap::changeLocation (  uint32  oldLocation,
uint32  newLocation,
ItemTypes::itemType  locationType,
bool  changeLocationItem = true
) 
 

Changes the location of all items belonging to a municipal or builtUpArea to a new location.

Used when the locationItem is given a new ID, e.g. in compactMunicipals or mergeSameNameBuas. NB. Works for municipal location and builtUparea location, not for any other location.

Parameters:
oldLocation The location to change.
newLocation The new location of items.
locationType What part of the location to change, municipal or bultiuparea.
changeLocationItem States if the location of the locationitem should be changed. The locationitem = the item that IS the location, i.e. the bua with the same itemID as the bualocation to change. Deafult is true.
Returns:
The number of items that had their location changed.

uint32 GMSMap::changeZoomLevel (  OldItem *  item,
uint32  zoomLevel
) 
 

Changes zoom level of the item.

The old place in m_itemsZoom is set to NULL (not NullObject). Note that this method assumes that no OldConnections are created yet. The effect is that the id of the item will be changed.

Parameters:
item The item to change zoomlevel of.
zoomLevel The new zoomlevel.
Returns:
The new ID of the item.

bool GMSMap::compactBuiltUpAreas (   ) 
 

Concatenate the built-up areas that have the same name into one built-up area with many names.

Also make sure that the buas have the first IDs in the itemZooms-array.

Returns:
True if the compactation is performed ok, false otherwise.

bool GMSMap::compactMunicipals (   ) 
 

Concatenate the municipals that have the same name into one municipals with many names.

Also make sure that the municipals have the first IDs in the itemZooms-array.

Returns:
True if the compactation is performed ok, false otherwise.

virtual OldConnection* GMSMap::createNewConnection (  DataBuffer *  dataBuffer  )  [private, virtual]

void GMSMap::itemInItemToDisplayClass (  ItemTypes::areaFeatureDrawDisplayClass_t  displayClass,
uint32  interiorItemMaxLength,
uint32  exteriorItemMinLength,
bool  compareIntWithExt,
float  quotaRequired,
mapTypeToItemId_t *  interiorItemsToUse,
mapTypeToItemId_t *  exteriorItemsToUse,
mapItemIdToBB_t  mapItemIdToBB,
mapTypeToItemId_t  mapTypeToItemId,
mapTypeToItemId_t *  foundInteriorItems
)  [private]
 

Method to compute which items belong to one specific area feature draw display class.

As an example, an item belongs to display class waterInCityPark if it is a water (interior) item that lies, partially or completely, inside an (exterior) city park item.

Parameters:
displayClass the display class
interiorItemMaxLength the maximum total lenght (circumference) of the interior item. NOTE: param disregarded if compareIntWithExt = true (see below).
exteriorItemMinLength the minimun total length (circumference) of the exterior item. NOTE: param disregarded if compareIntWithExt = true (see below).
compareIntWithExt If true then interiorItemMaxLength and exteriorItemMinLength are both disregarded, and instead we require that the total interior item length is smaller than the exterior item total length.
quotaRequired [The number of coordinates from the interior item that lie inside the exterior item] / [total number of coords in the interior item] > quotaRequired.
interiorItemsToUse If != NULL, we will not loop all items of the interior item type, but instead only consider these specific items. For example used when water in parks have been previously identified, and we want to identify islands in these water in parks.
exteriorItemsToUse If != NULL, we will not loop all items of the exterior item type, but instead only consider these specific items.
mapItemIdToBB Mapping from item id to item bounding box.
mapTypeToItemId Mapping from an item type to all items (ids) of that type.
foundInteriorItems This variable stores all items that are found to be interior items.

bool GMSMap::itemsShareNameStrIdx (  OldItem *  firstItem,
OldItem *  secondItem
)  [protected]
 

Tells if these items have a name with the same string index.

bool GMSMap::mergeSameNameAdminAreas (  ItemTypes::itemType  itemType,
uint32  maxMergeDist,
bool  updateLocation = false,
bool  simplifyMergedGfxs = false
) 
 

Merge admin areas (bua or municipal) area items when the following is true: (1) The items have the same name.

(2) The items are close to each other, either: (1) The item have gfxdata, and the gfxdatas are close. (2) The item doesn't have gfxdata but the convex hull made up by all other items having it as location is close.

The gfxDatas of all mergeable admin areas are added to one of the admin areas, and the rest of are removed from the map.

Parameters:
itemType The itemtype of the admin area to merge. Can either be bua or municipal.
maxMergeDist The maximum distance (meters) between two built-up areas for them to be considered close enough to be merged.
updateLocation If set, the location of all items that were in a removed bua is updated to the new bua. (Default is false = don't update)
simplifyMergedGfxs If set, any gfxData that has been merged will be simplifyed to ensure that it is not divided by any line across it.

bool GMSMap::mergeStreets (  vector< u32set > &  theSplitStreets  )  [private]
 

Help method to splitStreets.

Tries to merge together streets in the theSplitStreets that have common streetsegments. In order to merge all streets in the street array, this method should be called until no streets are merged.

Parameters:
theSplitStreets Input/Output param. Vector of set<uint32>. Each set<uint32> represents the ssi id:s of a seperate street.
Returns:
True if any streets were merged, false otherwise.

bool GMSMap::mergeStreetsOnLine (  vector< u32set > &  theSplitStreets  )  [private]
 

Method that should be called after mergeStreets.

Tries to merge streets lying on a line, which is often the case in the US.

Parameters:
theSplitStreets Input/Output param. Vector of set<uint32>. Each set<uint32> represents the ssi id:s of a seperate street.
Returns:
True if any streets were merged, false otherwise.

bool GMSMap::removeDuplicatedStreetNames (   ) 
 

Removes street names, which are an exact copy of another street name of the same street segment item.

These may be present because the maps had two version of a name only different in case. We change the case of all names and this may result in two exacly alike names on the same item.

bool GMSMap::removeEmptyLocationItems (  ItemTypes::itemType  itemType  ) 
 

Removes all location items of the specified type (zip, bua or mun) that don't have any other item having them as location.

If the item is marked as item-not-in-search-index, it is not regarded a location item and is hence not removed even if no items have it as group (as they shouldn't).

Parameters:
itemType The location item type. Municipal or bua supported.
Returns:
True if indata was OK, false otherwise.

bool GMSMap::removeGroups (  ItemTypes::itemType  itemType  ) 
 

Removes all groups that are of type item type from all items.

Parameters:
itemType When a group of an item points at this itemType it will be removed from the item.
Returns:
True if successful, otherwise false.

uint32 GMSMap::removeNoNameBuasInNoNameMunicipals (   ) 
 

Loop all built-up areas.

All no-name built-up area that are located in a no-name municipal are removed from the map. Also no-name buas that are not located in any municipal are removed. Will speed up mergeSameNameAdminAreas. The merge-method was really slow in e.g. Nigeria. Also needed in countries where we want to avoid that no-name buas inherit their name from the no-name municipal that inherited from the name of the country.

Returns:
The number of noname buas that were removed.

uint32 GMSMap::removeNoNameCityParts (   ) 
 

Loop all city parts and remove all no-name city parts the map.

City parts comes e.g. from TA order9 features

Returns:
The number of noname city parts that were removed.

uint32 GMSMap::updateCongestionSpeedLimits (   ) 
 

Will update the speedlimits for certain (hardcoded) cities that have severe traffic congestion.

Given a city with traffic congestion, the streets at the citycentre will get the lowest speedlimit (a percentage of the ordinary speedlimit). The speedlimits will lineary increase up to 100% of normal speed when reaching the max radius of the congestion area.

Returns:
The number of updated speedlimits.

bool GMSMap::updateConnections (  OldRouteableItem *  item,
bool  fakeUpdate = false,
uint32  maxDist = 2,
bool  itemIsForeign = false,
bool  onlyConnectToFerries = false
)  [private]
 

Update or check if any connections need to be updated from a RoutableItem.

Parameters:
item The routeable item.
fakeUpdate Optional parameter. If set to true the method will not actually add any connections, however the return value will indicate whether any connections need to be updated. This is used in order to check if a routeableitem fits this map. Default set to false.
maxDist Maximum allowed distance (in meters) to other nodes in order to allow a connection. Default set to 2 m.
itemIsForeign Optional parameter that indicates whether item is foreign (ie. not in this map). Default set to not being foregin.
onlyConnectToFerries Optional parameter that should be set to true if the item should only be allowed to connect to other ferry items.
Returns:
True if any connections were added, false otherwise.

uint32 GMSMap::updateForeignBuaNames (   ) 
 

Go through all bua:s and update the names so that they have the same name as their municipal in case they already have a common name.

TeleAtlas usually stores the names of the large municipals in several languages whereas the bua name is just in the native language (i.e. in case the bua and municipal have the same name).

Returns:
The number of names added to the builtupareas.

Vector* GMSMap::m_itemsFromExtraItemMap [protected]
 

A vector used when adding items from an extraItemMap to this map.

It will then hold the id's of items that have been added from the extra item map to this map, to enable some extra check if a extraSSI fits this map or not.
